Trial_Design.evidence: 42 patients underwent elective endovascular repair of a TAAA using custom designed multi-branched stent-grafts at a single academic institution.

Participants.evidence: 42 patients underwent elective endovascular repair of a TAAA using custom designed multi-branched stent-grafts at a single academic institution.

Intervention.evidence: endovascular repair of a TAAA using custom designed multi-branched stent-grafts

Objective.evidence: To characterize the inflammatory and coagulopathic response after endovascular thoracoabdominal aortic aneurysm (TAAA) repair and to evaluate the effect of the response on post-operative renal function.

Method_Outcome.evidence: White blood cell count (WBC), platelet count, prothrombin time (PT), and creatinine were measured in all patients.

Number_Randomised.evidence: From 7/2005 to 6/2008, 42 patients underwent elective endovascular repair of a TAAA

Number_Analysed.evidence: 4 patients were excluded from the analysis.

Result_Outcome.evidence: The 30-day mortality rate was 5% (2/38). All patients (n=38) had a higher WBC (mean±SD: 139 ± 80%, P<0.0001), lower platelet count (56 ± 15%, P<0.0001), and higher PT (median: 17%, IQR 12 - 22%, P<0.0001) after stent-graft insertion.

Harms.evidence: Twelve of 38 patients (32%) developed postoperative acute renal insufficiency (>50% rise in creatinine).
